definition: to go against/to be contrary to/to violate
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: S. joint communiques and the fundamental norms governing international relations.
sentences.chinese: 它違背《中美三個聯合公報》和基本的國際關係準則。

sentences.english: andeven those of their own instituting they frequently infringe.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連自己定下的規則也常常違背。

sentences.english: Such images have contributed to the taboo against marriage between first cousins.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的病態歸咎於對近親結婚禁忌的違背。
當農民違背自然規律時。

sentences.english: This approach might seem counter-intuitive to many managers.
sentences.chinese: 對於很多管理人員來說，這種方法似乎是違背直覺的。

sentences.english: These all run counter to the national interests.
sentences.chinese: 這一切都是違背民族利益的。

sentences.english: It seems counterintuitive that climate change could be responsible for both withering droughts and devastating floods.
sentences.chinese: 如果說乾旱和洪水都源於氣候變暖，這有些違背直覺。

sentences.english: I have been acting contrary to all my sense of right;
sentences.chinese: 我的行爲違背了我的是非觀。

sentences.english: Fate is not constant, against the truth.
sentences.chinese: 隨緣不變，則是不違背真理。

sentences.english: Enterprise's psychological contract violation does not necessarily lead to negative consumer's post-purchase behaviours.
sentences.chinese: 企業心理契約違背不一定導致負面的消費者購後行爲。

sentences.english: Very bad. You violate the Hund Rule.
sentences.chinese: 那很糟糕，你違背了洪特定律。

sentences.english: In some countries, this is close to breaching privacy legislation.
sentences.chinese: 這在一些國家是接近違背隱私保護法規的行爲。

sentences.english: To be honest, what I've seen offends my Presbyterian conscience .
sentences.chinese: 老實說，我所看到的是和我正直的內心相違背的。

sentences.english: Ensure that legislative and other requirements are not contravened .
sentences.chinese: 相等的標準，保證不違背立法和其他的要求。

sentences.english: Open source seems at first as though it violates the expectations of a functioning marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 開源在一開始好像違背了市場運作的預期方式。

sentences.english: No matter who you are, you cannot do anything going against nature.
sentences.chinese: 不管你是誰，都決不會做違背自然規律事。

definition: to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
norm/standard/specification/regulation/rule/within the rules/to fix rules/to regulate/to specify
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
